prs.truncated_body:
## Motivation
Tron wiring tasks failed because contract addresses from the LayerZero SDK were passed in raw hex format. TronWeb expects base58 addresses and would fail to call `getSendLibrary` or `setReceiveLibrary`.

## What changed
- added `toBase58` helper in `tasks/tron/wire.ts`
- converted Endpoint and library addresses to base58 before creating contracts and sending transactions
- updated pe

prs.title: fix: always run codeql advanced
prs.truncated_body:
### Changes

- Remove conditional execution of CodeQL

### Motivation

If `github/codeql-action/init` and `github/codeql-action/analyze` actions are skipped, the check is considered as not passed. So we have to run them anyways.

Given that this is only taking about 4.5 minutes now. We should just run it all the time.

---

prs.title: Fix silent logging failures when context values don't implement slog.LogValuer
prs.truncated_body:
**Problem:**
Context values stored without implementing `slog.LogValuer` caused `contextHandler.Handle()` to return errors that were silently swallowed by the slog system, resulting in missing log messages with no indication of the problem.

**Solution:**
- Modified `contextHandler.Handle()` to log errors to stderr instead of returning them
- Invalid context values are now skipped with visibl

prs.title: Prune old witnesses
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This PR adds a background goroutine that wakes every h.witnessPruneInterval to prune any witnesses older than the retention threshold. A persistent database cursor ensures each run picks up exactly where the last left off—avoiding redundant scans—and bounds the pruning window. All eligible witness hashes are deleted in a single batched transaction, the cursor is advanced atomicall

prs.title: [tmpnet] Enable exclusive scheduling
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

tmpnet previously supported deploying avalanchego nodes as kubernetes pods, but didn't provide a way to ensure that nodes had guaranteed reservations of compute and memory. This PR introduces a simple mechanism enabling each node in a network deployed with tmpnet to a kube cluster to be scheduled to its own dedicated and appropriately-sized kube node.  

## How th

commits.message:
[tmpnet] Enable exclusive scheduling

Setting `--kube-use-exclusive-scheduling` when deploying a network
with tmpnet with `--runtime=kube` will ensure that each avalanchego
node in the network will be scheduled to a beefy dedicated Kubernetes
node. This avoids contention for resources between nodes and other
applications. Node selection is configured by
`--kube-scheduling-label-key` and `--kube-scheduling-label-value`.

prs.title: Update Mailbox capabilities
prs.truncated_body:
We now pass the modref as part of the ONLY_MAILBOX capability, then on the downstream contract, it has to validate against it's own module name to prevent re-use in other modules.  Split out the capability for post-dispatch functionality as it's a separate purpose for merkle-tree table updates.

Modified repl tests and added a few small changes to mailbox restrict one action in define-hook and m

commits.message:
Update Mailbox capabilities

We now pass the modref as part of the ONLY_MAILBOX capability, then on the downstream contract, it has to validate against it's own module name to prevent re-use in other modules.  Split out the capability for post-dispatch functionality as it's a separate purpose for merkle-tree table updates.

Modified repl tests and added a few small changes to mailbox restrict one action in define-hook and moved process code around slightly.

Noting this again in Github, but there are a lot of expect-failure tests which clearly aren't correct based on the assumption, anyone using this in repl needs to test against the expected failure, not just that it fails.

Added more validation

Added the entire input of handle into the ONLY_MAILBOX cap, then renamed to ONLY_MAILBOX_CALL to correct name it.  I noted reciever is spelled wrong and inconsistent.  I reverted fixing because the interface itself is spelled wrong and that isn't worth modifying at this time.  updated POST_DISPATCH to POST_DISPATCH_CALL
fix: wrong naming template + wrong cap handle

prs.title: chore: automate lifecycle of TransactionGenerator
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR ensures we start and stop `TurtleTransactionGenerator` automatically when the `TurtleNetwork` is started and stopped. This avoids dealing with the `TransactionGenerator` in almost all tests.

(The only tests I can think of right now that require using the `TransactionGenerator` are tests related to quiescence.)


**Related issue(s)**:

Fixes #19251

commits.message:
Start and stop TurtleTransactionGenerator automatically when TurtleNetwork is started and stopped
